author: Staff Reporter
text:
Film producer-director Vetrimaran gives away Sivaji Ganesan award to S. Bhargavi fromIIT-Madras at Milan '16 at SRM University in Kattankulathur on Sunday.— Photo: G. Krishnaswamy

The four day annual cultural festival Milan ’16 culminated at SRM University with a colourful valedictory session on Sunday.

National award winning film producer-director Vetrimaran distributed prizes to winners at the end of the festival.

He was presented the Balu Mahendra Award instituted by the University for his latest hit ‘Visaranai.’

The award was given by Shanky Mahendra son of his mentor, cinematographer-director, Balu Mahendra.

He presented the Sivaji Ganesan Award to S. Bhargavi of IIT-Madras.

The best college award was bagged by VIT, while Raja Thomson of SRM bagged the K. Balachander award.

As the curtains came down on the SRM University’s four-day festival, students poured into the outdoor stadium to get a glimpse of the producer-director Vetrimaran.

The festival was inaugurated by actor-producer John Abraham and there was a musical extravaganza by ‘DSP’, (Devi Sri Prasad) on Saturday. The Hindu is the media partner.
title: Milan ’16 comes to a colourful close
